Title: I like novels
Kanji: さくら： ロドリゴさん　の　趣味　は　何　です　か？
ロドリゴ: 読書　です。　得に　歴史　小説　が　すき　です
さくら： へえ。新宿 に　新しい　本屋　が　出来ました　よ。　みんな　で　行きません　か
Kana: さくら： ロドリゴさん　の　しゅみ　は　なん　です　か？
ロドリゴ:　どくしょ　です。　とくに　れきし　しょうせつ　が　すき　です
さくら：　へえ。しんじゅく に　あたらしい　ほんや　が　できました　よ。　みんな　で　生きません　か
Romaji: Sakura: Rodorigo-San no shumi wa nan desu ka
Rodorigo: Dokusho desu. Tokuni rekishi shousetsu ga suki desu.
Sakura: Hee. Shinjuku ni atarashi hon-ya ga dekimashita yo. Minna de ikimasen ka.
English: Sakura: Rodrigo, What is your hobby?
Rodrigo: It's reading books. I specially like historical novels.
Sakura: A new bookstore has opened in Shinjuki. Why don't we all go together?
Vocabulary: 読書 = Reading books (どくしょ - Dokusho)
得 = Adverb Specially  (とくに - Tokuni)
小説 = Novels (しょうせつ - Shousetsu)
新宿 = It's a place in Tokyo Sinjuku
に = Particle indicating a place in this case.
新しい = Adjective New (あたらしい - Atarashi)
出来ました = Past form of verb 出来ます Open (できました - Dekimashita)
Description: A likes B = A は　B が　好き　です (A wa B ga suki desu): 好き(Suki) is an adjective meaning 'to be fond of or to like'
アンナ　は　まんが　が　好き　です (Anna wa manga ga suki desu) = Anna likes manga
Adjectives are divided basically into 2 kinds:
- Adjectives ending with the syllabe I. (I-Adjectives:)
We place adjectives before the nouns to modify them:
- 新しい　本　(Atarashii hon) = A new book
To modify a noun with this kind of adjectives we add な(na) to them. They are called NA-Adjectives
The adjective 好き（Suki) Like, it's not an I-Adjective, it doesn't end with I. In this case it's an NA-Adjective. It needs to add Na to modify the noun:
- 好き(Suki)　+ 本(Hon)　=  好きな　本(Sukina hon) => The book I like
